description: sops - sops - encrypted file editor with AWS KMS, GCP KMS, Azure Key Vault, age, and GPG support

global_flags.description: add the provided comma-separated list of age recipients fingerprints to the list of master keys on the given file
add the provided comma-separated list of Azure Key Vault key URLs to the list of master keys on the given file
add the provided comma-separated list of GCP KMS key resource IDs to the list of master keys on the given file
add the provided comma-separated list of Vault's URI key to the list of master keys on the given file ( eg. https://vault.example.org:8200/v1/transit/keys/dev)
add the provided comma-separated list of KMS ARNs to the list of master keys on the given file
add the provided comma-separated list of PGP fingerprints to the list of master keys on the given file
comma separated list of age recipients [$SOPS_AGE_RECIPIENTS]
The AWS profile to use for requests to AWS
comma separated list of Azure Key Vault URLs [$SOPS_AZURE_KEYVAULT_URLS]
path to sops' config file. If set, sops will not search for the config file recursively.
decrypt a file and output the result to stdout
comma separated list of decryption key types [$SOPS_DECRYPTION_ORDER]
do not check whether the current version is latest during --version
use local key service
encrypt a file and output the result to stdout
set the encrypted comment suffix. When specified, only keys that have comment matching the regex will be encrypted.
set the encrypted key regex. When specified, only keys matching the regex will be encrypted.
override the encrypted key suffix. When empty, all keys will be encrypted, unless otherwise marked with unencrypted-suffix.
comma separated list of KMS encryption context key:value pairs
extract a specific key or branch from the input document. Decrypt mode only. Example: --extract '["somekey"][0]'
Use this filename instead of the provided argument for loading configuration, and for determining input type and output type
comma separated list of GCP KMS resource IDs [$SOPS_GCP_KMS_IDS]
comma separated list of vault's key URI (e.g. 'https://vault.example.org:8200/v1/transit/keys/dev') [$SOPS_VAULT_URIS]
show help
ignore Message Authentication Code during decryption
write output back to the same file instead of stdout
the number of spaces to indent YAML or JSON encoded file (default: 0)
currently json, yaml, dotenv and binary are supported. If not set, sops will use the file's extension to determine the type
Specify the key services to use in addition to the local one. Can be specified more than once. Syntax: protocol://address. Example: tcp://myserver.com:5000
comma separated list of KMS ARNs [$SOPS_KMS_ARN]
compute MAC only over values which end up encrypted
Save the output after encryption or decryption to the file specified
currently json, yaml, dotenv and binary are supported. If not set, sops will use the input file's extension to determine the output format
comma separated list of PGP fingerprints [$SOPS_PGP_FP]
remove the provided comma-separated list of age recipients from the list of master keys on the given file
remove the provided comma-separated list of Azure Key Vault key URLs from the list of master keys on the given file
remove the provided comma-separated list of GCP KMS key resource IDs from the list of master keys on the given file
remove the provided comma-separated list of Vault's URI key from the list of master keys on the given file ( eg. https://vault.example.org:8200/v1/transit/keys/dev)
remove the provided comma-separated list of KMS ARNs from the list of master keys on the given file
remove the provided comma-separated list of PGP fingerprints from the list of master keys on the given file
generate a new data encryption key and reencrypt all values with the new key
set a specific key or branch in the input document. value must be a json encoded string. (edit mode only). eg. --set '["somekey"][0] {"somevalue":true}'
the number of master keys required to retrieve the data key with shamir (default: 0)
display master encryption keys in the file during editing
set the unencrypted comment suffix. When specified, only keys that have comment matching the regex will be left unencrypted.
set the unencrypted key regex. When specified, only keys matching the regex will be left unencrypted.
override the unencrypted key suffix.
Enable verbose logging output
print the version

subcommands.name: exec-env
subcommands.description: execute a command with decrypted values inserted into the environment

flags.description: background the process and don't wait for it to complete (DEPRECATED)
use local key service
Specify the key services to use in addition to the local one. Can be specified more than once. Syntax: protocol://address. Example: tcp://myserver.com:5000
insert only the decrypted values into the environment without forwarding existing environment variables
the user to run the command as

subcommands.name: exec-file
subcommands.description: execute a command with the decrypted contents as a temporary file

flags.description: background the process and don't wait for it to complete (DEPRECATED)
use local key service
filename for the temporarily file (default: tmp-file)
currently ini, json, yaml, dotenv and binary are supported. If not set, sops will use the file's extension to determine the type
Specify the key services to use in addition to the local one. Can be specified more than once. Syntax: protocol://address. Example: tcp://myserver.com:5000
use a regular file instead of a fifo to temporarily hold the decrypted contents
currently ini, json, yaml, dotenv and binary are supported. If not set, sops will use the input file's extension to determine the output format
the user to run the command as

subcommands.name: filestatus
subcommands.description: check the status of the file, returning encryption status

subcommands.name: groups
subcommands.description: modify the groups on a SOPS file

flags.description: show help

subcommands.name: add
subcommands.description: add a new group to a SOPS file

flags.description: the age recipient the new group should contain. Can be specified more than once
The AWS profile to use for requests to AWS
the Azure Key Vault key URL the new group should contain. Can be specified more than once
use local key service
comma separated list of KMS encryption context key:value pairs
the file to add the group to
the GCP KMS Resource ID the new group should contain. Can be specified more than once

the full vault path to the key used to encrypt/decrypt. Make you choose and configure a key with encryption/decryption enabled (e.g. 'https://vault.example.org:8200/v1/transit/keys/dev'). Can be specified more than once
write output back to the same file instead of stdout
Specify the key services to use in addition to the local one. Can be specified more than once. Syntax: protocol://address. Example: tcp://myserver.com:5000
the KMS ARNs the new group should contain. Can be specified more than once
the PGP fingerprints the new group should contain. Can be specified more than once
the number of master keys required to retrieve the data key with shamir (default: 0)

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Shows a list of commands or help for one command

subcommands.name: keyservice
subcommands.description: start a SOPS key service server

flags.description: address to listen on, e.g. '127.0.0.1:5000' or '/tmp/sops.sock' (default: "127.0.0.1:5000")
network to listen on, e.g. 'tcp' or 'unix' (default: "tcp")
Prompt user to confirm every incoming request
Enable verbose logging output

subcommands.name: publish
subcommands.description: Publish sops file or directory to a configured destination

flags.description: use local key service
Specify the key services to use in addition to the local one. Can be specified more than once. Syntax: protocol://address. Example: tcp://myserver.com:5000
Omit file extensions in destination path when publishing sops file to configured destinations
If the source path is a directory, publish all its content recursively
Enable verbose logging output
pre-approve all changes and run non-interactively

subcommands.name: rotate

the number of master keys required to retrieve the data key with shamir (default: 0)
